meanings.definition: To spread out or open up
meanings.sent1: She unfurled the map to find the right direction.
meanings.sent2: The flag unfurled in the wind as the parade began.
meanings.sent3: The magician unfurled a giant scarf from his sleeve, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unfurled like a blooming flower, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The curtains unfurled slowly, revealing a breathtaking view of the mountains.
